intro: Dorstenia frutescens, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that often have a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming during the rainy season. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Dorstenia frutescens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
